issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
The wireframe (https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+Scaling+Group) shows Termination policies selection box but the UI is missing it, even though this field is required. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Dashboard
# Scaling Groups
# Create Scaling Groups - General Tab
# Capacity section
fields.summary: Missing field in Capacity area of Scaling Group Wizard General Tab

comments.body: [~tvo], [~jloza], [~alice]: The terminate policies field, which isn't a checkbox, is in the 4.2 console.  Screenshot attached.
I confirmed the terminate policy filed is showing correctly on shared setup #1 (Edge mode).
Closing as not a bug. Field is present.

I see the field is missing in 4.3 - see attached.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

[~tvo] is right, it is missing on the create wizard. [~kgill]'s screenshot is of the details page. 

Not a critical bug for 4.2.2 as the default policy is always in place, and customers have not noticed this (default is most commonly used as well). Targeting for 4.3
Yeah, sorry I misread this, thinking it was on the details page.  Will leave my screenshot here for comparison purposes.
[~kgill], assigning to you so we have an owner for this, but feel free to re-assign to the right developer.
[~dcalzago]: Works for me, thanks!
Fixed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1952
Not happy with the way the label wraps so that the help icon is on a second row. There's enough margin to fit this on one row. Passing UX review anyway, sigh.

[~jloza]: After discussing this ticket on IRC I pushed a commit (see https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/8e5b818994dc) making the following changes that probably warrant another UX review...

- When termination policies aren't specified, they're set to 'Default'.  As the termination policies field is marked as required in the scaling group wizard, I pushed a change that sets the default value to 'Default'.
- I changed the label/input column ratios for the termination policies field from 3/9 to 4/8, and now the label doesn't wrap.

Could you have another look?
Looks good, code-wise.  Reassigning to [~jloza] to answer UX questions/re-review.

Thanks for adding the default policy, that should always be there. However, the column breakdown is no good. The fields should be left aligned and aren't any longer. Please revert that part. Thanks for trying, though.
Fixed column ratios for termination policies field.
UX review passed (with sad face for wizard margins). Ready for code review. Thanks, guys!
[~dkavanagh] Reassigning this to you for a second code review stamp of approval.
Just the one comment in the PR, then good to merge.

[~dkavanagh]: Re your comment in PR 1952, the 'self.termination_policies.error_msg = self.termination_policies_error_msg' line is our usual WTForms way of surfacing the error message to the template (see form_field_row.pt).  I didn't want to switch to the Angular way since that's a much bigger change, but perhaps we'll get there in the next release.
Field is shown in the UI now, approving for release.
